--- title: Sampling keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "Functions which sample nodes or edges in graphs" ---
{% raw %}

Node sampling¶

sample_node[source]

sample_node(G)

Uniformly samples a single node from G.

sample_nodes[source]

sample_nodes(G, num_nodes=1)

Uniformly samples num_nodes nodes.

Nodes are sampled uniformly at random without replacement and returned in a list.

Edge sampling¶

sample_edges[source]

sample_edges(G, r, non_pendant=False)

Samples r edges from G.

Edges are sampled uniformly at random without replacement and returned as a list.

If non_pendant is True then pendant edges will not be sampled.

Subgraph sampling¶

khop_subgraph[source]

khop_subgraph(G, k, node=None)

Returns a subgraph of G which is the k-hop neighbourhood of some node.

If node=None then a node is randomly sampled.

khop_neighbourhood[source]

khop_neighbourhood(G, k, node)

Returns the k-hop neighbourhood of node.

dilate[source]

dilate(G, nodes)

Returns a list which contains the union of the neighbourhood of all nodes.

Args: G: A networkx graph. nodes: A list of nodes, all elements must be contained in G.nodes().

Returns: A list containing the dilation of the nodes.

{% endraw %}
